Table of Contents

Class FramedClock

Namespace
osu.Framework.Timing
Assembly
osu.Framework.dll

Takes a clock source and separates time reading on a per-frame level. The CurrentTime value will only change on initial construction and whenever ProcessFrame is run.

public class FramedClock : IFrameBasedClock, ISourceChangeableClock, IClock

Constructors

FramedClock(IClock?, bool)

Construct a new FramedClock with an optional source clock.

public FramedClock(IClock? source = null, bool processSource = true)

Parameters

source IClock

A source clock which will be used as the backing time source. If null, a StopwatchClock will be created. When provided, the CurrentTime of source will be transferred instantly.

processSource bool

Whether the source clock's ProcessFrame() method should be called during this clock's process call.

Properties

CurrentTime

The current time of this clock, in milliseconds.

public virtual double CurrentTime { get; protected set; }

Property Value

double

ElapsedFrameTime

Elapsed time since last frame in milliseconds.

public double ElapsedFrameTime { get; }

Property Value

double

FramesPerSecond

A moving average representation of the frames per second of this clock. Do not use this for any timing purposes (use ElapsedFrameTime instead).

public double FramesPerSecond { get; }
